intro: Cheiloclinium meianthum, commonly known as the velvetleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, disturbed habitats and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Cheiloclinium meianthum is also known for its fibrous stems, which have been used traditionally in some regions for various purposes.
